title: mblab/callvariants pipeline - params.input schema
description: Schema for the file provided with params.input

sample.errorMessage: Sample name must be provided, must be unique, and cannot contain spaces

group.errorMessage: Group name must be provided and cannot contain spaces. This may be numeric. This determines the sets of samples that will be combined for joint variant calling

genome_name.errorMessage: `genome_name` is used to avoid creating duplicate indicies when multiple samples use the same genome. What matters here is internal consistency in a given samplesheet -- let's say you have three groups of samples: a group which uses the input genome, a group which has marker_1 and a group with has marker_2. For the input genome group, you would maybe set `genome_name` to `input_genome`. For the marker_1 group, you would set `genome_name` to `input_genome_marker_1`. For the marker_2 group, you would set `genome_name` to `input_genome_marker_2`. The names are arbitrary. What matters is that the `genome_name` and `additional_sequence` entries are consistent within a set.

fastq_1.errorMessage: FastQ file for reads 1 must be provided, cannot contain spaces and must have extension '.fq.gz' or '.fastq.gz'

fastq_2.errorMessage: FastQ file for reads 2 cannot contain spaces and must have extension '.fq.gz' or '.fastq.gz'

additional_fasta.errorMessage: [Optional] Any additional sequences to append to the genome for a given sample. Must be in fasta format. The filename cannot contain spaces and must have extension '.fa', '.fasta' or '.fasta.gz'
